verses.text: A \add good\add* name \add is\add* rather to be chosen than great riches , \add and\add* loving favour rather than silver and gold.\f + \fr 22.1 \ft loving…: or, favour is better than, etc\f*
The rich and poor meet together : the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add is\add* the maker of them all.
A prudent \add man\add* foreseeth the evil , and hideth himself: but the simple pass on , and are punished.
By humility \add and\add* the fear of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add are\add* riches , and honour , and life.\f + \fr 22.4 \ft By…: or, The reward of humility, etc\f*
Thorns \add and\add* snares \add are\add* in the way of the froward : he that doth keep his soul shall be far from them.
Train up a child in the way he should go : and when he is old , he will not depart from it.\f + \fr 22.6 \ft Train…: or, Catechise\f*\f + \fr 22.6 \ft in…: Heb. in his way\f*
The rich ruleth over the poor , and the borrower \add is\add* servant to the lender.\f + \fr 22.7 \ft the lender: Heb. the man that lendeth\f*
He that soweth iniquity shall reap vanity : and the rod of his anger shall fail.\f + \fr 22.8 \ft the rod…: or, with the rod of his anger he shall be consumed\f*
He that hath a bountiful eye shall be blessed ; for he giveth of his bread to the poor.\f + \fr 22.9 \ft He that…: Heb. Good of eye\f*
Cast out the scorner , and contention shall go out ; yea, strife and reproach shall cease.
He that loveth pureness of heart , \add for\add* the grace of his lips the king \add shall be\add* his friend.\f + \fr 22.11 \ft for…: or, and hath grace in his lips\f*
The eyes of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* preserve knowledge , and he overthroweth the words of the transgressor.\f + \fr 22.12 \ft the words: or, the matters\f*
The slothful \add man\add* saith , \add There is\add* a lion without , I shall be slain in the streets.
The mouth of strange women \add is\add* a deep pit : he that is abhorred of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* shall fall therein.
Foolishness \add is\add* bound in the heart of a child ; \add but\add* the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.
He that oppresseth the poor to increase his \add riches, and\add* he that giveth to the rich , \add shall\add* surely \add come\add* to want. \p
Bow down thine ear , and hear the words of the wise , and apply thine heart unto my knowledge.
For \add it is\add* a pleasant thing if thou keep them within thee; they shall withal be fitted in thy lips.\f + \fr 22.18 \ft within…: Heb. in thy belly\f*
That thy trust may be in the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, I have made known to thee this day , even to thee.\f + \fr 22.19 \ft even…: or, trust thou also\f*
Have not I written to thee excellent things in counsels and knowledge ,

That I might make thee know the certainty of the words of truth ; that thou mightest answer the words of truth to them that send unto thee?\f + \fr 22.21 \ft to them…: or, to those that send thee?\f* \p
Rob not the poor , because he \add is\add* poor : neither oppress the afflicted in the gate :
For the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* will plead their cause , and spoil the soul of those that spoiled them. \p
Make no friendship with an angry man ; and with a furious man thou shalt not go :
Lest thou learn his ways , and get a snare to thy soul. \p
Be not thou \add one\add* of them that strike hands , \add or\add* of them that are sureties for debts.
If thou hast nothing to pay , why should he take away thy bed from under thee?
Remove not the ancient landmark , which thy fathers have set.\f + \fr 22.28 \ft landmark: or, bound\f*
Seest thou a man diligent in his business ? he shall stand before kings ; he shall not stand before mean \add men\add*.\f + \fr 22.29 \ft mean…: Heb. obscure men\f*
